intro: Trichophyllum aciculare, commonly known as the needle-leaf moss, is a small, terrestrial moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves that are often arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. This moss typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, called capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks and release spores when mature. Trichophyllum aciculare plays a vital role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
